content:
• Thursday, August 25, 2011
  • UAL

    Airline shares took a hit today as investors anticipate a wave of flight cancellations due to...

    Airline shares took a hit today as investors anticipate a wave of flight cancellations due to Hurricane Irene. The ripple effects are likely to be felt across the country as flights become grounded throughout major U.S. travel corridors. United Continental (UAL -2.9%), AMR (AMR -2.9%), Delta (DAL -5.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM
  • RDS.A

    Royal Dutch Shell (NYSE:RDS.A) announces a buyback of 925K class B shares at 1971.85 pence per...

    Royal Dutch Shell (NYSE:RDS.A) announces a buyback of 925K class B shares at 1971.85 pence per share. RDS.B -3.2%, RDS.A +0.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • OVTI

    More on Omnivision (NASDAQ:OVTI): Shares plunge -30% in AH trading following weak guidance for...

    More on Omnivision (NASDAQ:OVTI): Shares plunge -30% in AH trading following weak guidance for the current quarter as margins get pressured from a slowing economy and growing competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • HAL

    Haliburton (NYSE:HAL) subsidiary KBR (KBR) is awarded a contract from Hyundai Heavy Industries...

    Haliburton (NYSE:HAL) subsidiary KBR (KBR) is awarded a contract from Hyundai Heavy Industries to perform engineering design and procurement support services for its floating production storage and offload project located west of Shetland Isles in UK waters. KBR +1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCRS

    MICROS Systems (NASDAQ:MCRS): FQ4 $0.58 beats by $0.9. Revenue of $274M (+10.4% Y/Y) beats by...

    MICROS Systems (NASDAQ:MCRS): FQ4 $0.58 beats by $0.9. Revenue of $274M (+10.4% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Reafirms FY12 guidance. Shares +2.4% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ1 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $276M (+43%...

    OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ1 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $276M (+43% Y/Y) in-line. Expects Q2 revenue of $255M-$275M vs. consensus of $306M, EPS of $0.52-$0.64, vs. consensus of $0.82. Shares -26.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • P

    More on Pandora's (NYSE:P) FQ2 results: Free cash flow for 1H 2011 was slightly positive. Total...

    More on Pandora's (NYSE:P) FQ2 results: Free cash flow for 1H 2011 was slightly positive. Total listener hours grew 125% Y/Y in FQ2 to 1.8B, leading Pandora's estimated share of U.S. radio listening to double to 3.6%. Mobile advertising now accounts for roughly half of the company's total ad revenue. P now +5.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • TENX

    Oxygen Biotherapeutics (OXBT -5.5%) finished down on the day after announcing earlier that its...

    Oxygen Biotherapeutics (OXBT -5.5%) finished down on the day after announcing earlier that its Chairman and CEO Chris Stern has left the company. The company further notes it will not pay Stern any severance "due to the circumstances surrounding his dismissal," without any further elaboration.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • CYBX

    Cyberonics (CYBX +3%) is higher going into the close after its FQ1 earnings beat estimates on a...

    Cyberonics (CYBX +3%) is higher going into the close after its FQ1 earnings beat estimates on a boost in international sales due to organizational changes made earlier this year. The company had seen a drop in sales earlier due to issues with its European business and post-quake turmoil in Japan.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • GGG

    BB&T cuts its stock rating on Graco (GGG -4.2%) to Hold, saying it sees few near-term upside...

    BB&T cuts its stock rating on Graco (GGG -4.2%) to Hold, saying it sees few near-term upside catalysts and increasing downside risks. Given continued headwinds facing the contractor segment, as well as the cloudy macro and industrial picture, it sees its prior 2012 EPS view for the fluid-handling company as too aggressive.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • AVNW

    Aviat Networks (AVNW -16.8%) hits fresh new 52-week lows - despite a decent FQ4 earnings report...

    Aviat Networks (AVNW -16.8%) hits fresh new 52-week lows - despite a decent FQ4 earnings report - after Q1 revenue guidance falls short of expectations and disclosing the departure of its chief financial officer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • GES

    Wedbush analyst Betty Chen cuts her PT for Guess? (GES -6.1%) to $37 from $50, saying the...

    Wedbush analyst Betty Chen cuts her PT for Guess? (GES -6.1%) to $37 from $50, saying the retailer faces near-term pressure on European slowdown worries. She also lowered estimates for FY11 EPS to $3.28-$3.40 - slightly higher than the firm's own guidance of $3.25-$3.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • AMAT

    Analysts aren't thrilled with Applied Materials' (AMAT -4.6%) FQ3 earnings report; J.P. Morgan...

    Analysts aren't thrilled with Applied Materials' (AMAT -4.6%) FQ3 earnings report; J.P. Morgan sees Applied's numbers as proof of a "full blown down cycle" that could extend into 2012. But Citi's Timothy Arcuri, who predicted Applied's weak FQ4 guidance, thinks the chip industry's equipment order levels are unsustainably low. (previously)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • PMC

    PharMerica (PMC +2.7%) follows up its harsh letter to Omnicare (OCR -2.1%) with the adoption of...

    PharMerica (PMC +2.7%) follows up its harsh letter to Omnicare (OCR -2.1%) with the adoption of a stockholder rights plan designed to thwart an unwelcome takeover.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • AGO

    The monoline mortgage insurance stocks have all been halted after hitting circuit breakers on...

    The monoline mortgage insurance stocks have all been halted after hitting circuit breakers on the way up. AGO +11%, MBI +6.9%, MTG +15%, RDN +18%., PMI +25%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • AOL

    AOL gains 2.7% following a report it's hired a law firm and an i-bank known for their M&A...

    AOL gains 2.7% following a report it's hired a law firm and an i-bank known for their M&A work; the law firm has a history of defending companies against hostile bids. CEO Tim Armstrong states there's "no deal on the table," but given AOL's low price/sales multiple and cash-cow dial-up business, it's not hard to see the company drawing some PE interest.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • PHM

    Shares of PulteGroup (PHM +13.3%) finally gain, following a dismal month that saw shares lose...

    Shares of PulteGroup (PHM +13.3%) finally gain, following a dismal month that saw shares lose 41% as homebuilder stocks were decimated. Yesterday, the firm's founder and former chairman said he may sell 13M shares - repping 3% of outstanding stock - to raise money for personal loans.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • MU

    Sterne Agee reiterates its Buy rating on Micron Technology (MU +2%) despite cutting its price...

    Sterne Agee reiterates its Buy rating on Micron Technology (MU +2%) despite cutting its price target to $14 from $17, saying the company's stock has been hit to very compelling valuations after pressure from weak DRAM demand. The semiconductor firm's operations and balance sheet also are better positioned than its peers, Sterne Agee says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • GM

    A deal between General Motors (GM -0.5%) and LG to develop an electric car, expands on an early...

    A deal between General Motors (GM -0.5%) and LG to develop an electric car, expands on an early collaboration between the two firms to outfit the Chevrolet Volt and hardware for the OnStar system. Shares of rival Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) are down 4% as electric car competition heats up.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • BRK.A

    Analyst give a strong thumbs-up to Berkshire's (BRK.A, BRK.B) investment in Bank of America (BAC...

    Analyst give a strong thumbs-up to Berkshire's (BRK.A, BRK.B) investment in Bank of America (BAC +10.2%). Raymond James' Anthony Polini, who defended the company yesterday, is again reiterating a Strong Buy, while Sandler O'Neill's Jeffrey Harte suggests BofA's fundamentals make it a $12 stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • BRK.A

    If you're Warren Buffett (NYSE:BRK.A), you can get deals the rest of us just can't get....

    If you're Warren Buffett (NYSE:BRK.A), you can get deals the rest of us just can't get. Dealbreaker’s Matt Levine crunches the numbers on Buffett’s Bank of America (BAC +9.7%) investment and estimates that the bank’s implied stock price in the $5B deal was $5.28/share, more than $2 less than where it currently trades.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • COHR

    Coherent (COHR -2.7%) announces a new $50M stock buyback plan after the laser products company...

    Coherent (COHR -2.7%) announces a new $50M stock buyback plan after the laser products company says it completed a previously announced $75M buyback. Shares were down 6% earlier today before recovering a bit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • BECN

    Beacon Roofing Supply (BECN +7%) jumps after William Blair says the company's revenue could grow...

    Beacon Roofing Supply (BECN +7%) jumps after William Blair says the company's revenue could grow at least $200M over the next 12-24 months if Hurricane Irene hits hard along the East Coast this weekend. Roofing materials are already in tight supply due to heavy snow and rain damage this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM

  • Gold bounces back as nervousness returns to equity markets, but is the selloff over? Some...

    Gold bounces back as nervousness returns to equity markets, but is the selloff over? Some traders see a buying opportunity, but BofA's MacNeil Curry thinks there’s a lot more downside left before the gold bull resumes. He sees similarities to the 2006 breakout and reversal, which would indicate a return to $1,462-$1,576 before eventual resumption of the larger secular bull trend.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • BCS

    Barclays (BCS +2.8%) gets a boost from positive comments by Morgan Stanley, saying in a note to...

    Barclays (BCS +2.8%) gets a boost from positive comments by Morgan Stanley, saying in a note to clients that the effects of a potential ring fence of UK banks' retail activities look "overly pessimistic." Morgan sees a small potential hit to Barclay's 2014 pretax profits, but expects any implementation of the proposal to be diluted, and pushed out as late as 2019.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • CARB

    Carbonite (CARB +14.8%) gains today, two weeks after the data backup company launched its IPO at...

    Carbonite (CARB +14.8%) gains today, two weeks after the data backup company launched its IPO at $10 in a less-than-perfect climate. Flybridge Capital's Michael Greeley says another IPO in the pipeline, Brightcove, resembles the Carbonite blueprint.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • BP

    Oil analysts say with the proper investment Libya's oil production could be improved from a...

    Oil analysts say with the proper investment Libya's oil production could be improved from a pre-war production run of 1.6M barrels a day, up to 3M barrels. The catch is that the payoff is years down the road. Oil players are down sharply today: BP -4.6%, SLB -2.8%, MPC -4.89%, SUN -2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 5 Comments
  • GAME

    Chinese gamer Shanda Games (GAME +11.2%) flies in the face of broad market headwinds, thanks to...

    Chinese gamer Shanda Games (GAME +11.2%) flies in the face of broad market headwinds, thanks to a stock upgrade to Buy from Hold at Deutsche Bank. A successful Q2 saw margins drop on higher input costs and salaries, but impressive revenue growth and the successful launch of several new games.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • CBRL

    Cracker Barrel (CBRL -3.2%) is lower today after rebuffing a request from activist investor...

    Cracker Barrel (CBRL -3.2%) is lower today after rebuffing a request from activist investor Biglari Holdings (BH-OLD -3.3%) to offer a more detailed breakout of its business segments, calling the proposal "neither required nor appropriate." Biglari says the company's failure to segregate its data breaches SEC accounting requirements.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • CB

    P&C insurance firms are taking a hit as Hurricane Irene is shaping up to be a storm of...

    P&C insurance firms are taking a hit as Hurricane Irene is shaping up to be a storm of biblical proportions. Chubb CB -3.7%, Allstate ALL -3.6%, Berkshire BRK.A -2.6%. Gov. Christie of New Jersey declares a state of emergency with a (so far) voluntary request for folks to leave shore areas.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • GSVC

    GSV Capital (GSVC +11.4%) shoots higher as the investment firm discloses new stakes in Groupon,...

    GSV Capital (GSVC +11.4%) shoots higher as the investment firm discloses new stakes in Groupon, Twitter, and Zynga.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) update: Currently at $7.45, the shares are at session lows, +6.8%...

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) update: Currently at $7.45, the shares are at session lows, +6.8% after being 25% higher near the open.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • P

    If Pandora (P -5.1%) is the canary in the coal mine for tech IPOs, upstarts may not like what...

    If Pandora (P -5.1%) is the canary in the coal mine for tech IPOs, upstarts may not like what they see. Shares are off 33% since the firm's debut, foundering well-before the Aug. market swoon. 4 tech IPOs have been delayed in the last 3 weeks - a number Renaissance Capital says could go higher and even ensnare hotshots Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) and Zynga.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM

  • Down another $60 this morning as Europe bounced and Buffett got behind Bank of America, gold...

    Down another $60 this morning as Europe bounced and Buffett got behind Bank of America, gold shoots higher as that euphoria fades. The metal is back to unchanged at $1,763/oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • ENER

    Energy Conversion Devices (ENER +18%) trades higher - despite posing a weak FQ4 on a 15% Y/Y dip...

    Energy Conversion Devices (ENER +18%) trades higher - despite posing a weak FQ4 on a 15% Y/Y dip in sales - after saying it sees signs of growth in key European markets, where subsidy cuts led to a glut of solar panels and sent prices plummeting earlier this year. The company also notes it's taking steps to lower expenses and improve operations in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • SCHS

    School Specialty (SCHS +5.6%) easily beats FQ1 consensus estimates, despite constricting state...

    School Specialty (SCHS +5.6%) easily beats FQ1 consensus estimates, despite constricting state budgets and overall reductions in school funding. Revenue climbed 9.1% on a boost in sales from the company's educational resources and accelerated learning segments, plus a shift in a high-volume shipping week from the last quarter to the present one. 

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (Z +25%) rockets higher following better-than-expected earnings and an upbeat conference...

    Zillow (Z +25%) rockets higher following better-than-expected earnings and an upbeat conference call. Conor Sen thinks the shares remain undervalued, pointing out the company has yet to scratch the surface of getting a piece of the $6B real estate advertising market.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI +7.6%) jumps higher this morning after the FDA grants orphan status...

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI +7.6%) jumps higher this morning after the FDA grants orphan status for its treatment of Buerger's disease, a rare, but severe illness that affects the blood vessels of the extremities.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • HRL

    Hormel Foods (HRL -6.4%) FQ3 was better than estimates, but the company issues a cautious...

    Hormel Foods (HRL -6.4%) FQ3 was better than estimates, but the company issues a cautious forecast for the current quarter, saying demand is weak from restaurants and food service operators due to growing economic concerns and higher gasoline costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • HEI

    Heico (HEI +3.1%)  beat FQ3 estimates as earnings jumped 37% on record quarterly sales from...

    Heico (HEI +3.1%)  beat FQ3 estimates as earnings jumped 37% on record quarterly sales from its commercial aviation division. The company also raises guidance for H2, now saying net income will rise 29% versus previous expectations of 20%, and sales will be up 20%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • SSNLF

    Two days after its deal with Samsung (OTC:SSNLF), Universal Display (PANL +19%) is surging...

    Two days after its deal with Samsung (OTC:SSNLF), Universal Display (PANL +19%) is surging again. Short-covering could be playing a role (15.7% of float shorted as of Jul. 29), as could optimism about new deals and the growth potential of the OLED market. DisplaySearch recently forecast triple-digit Y/Y growth for AMOLED capacity through 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • AAPL

    Let's get real: In the long run, Apple (AAPL -1.6%) will not be the same company without Steve...

    Let's get real: In the long run, Apple (AAPL -1.6%) will not be the same company without Steve Jobs, Jeff Macke writes. Consider Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) stock since Bill Gates left day-to-day operations in January 2000. From Henry Ford to Sam Walton to Howard Shultz, the history of companies after the departure of charismatic long-time leaders tends to be ugly.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 5 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is now down just 1.6% in the wake of Steve Jobs' resignation - barely worse...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is now down just 1.6% in the wake of Steve Jobs' resignation - barely worse than the NASDAQ's 1.5% decline. The market appears to have largely discounted Jobs' departure in advance of the official announcement. Though it also helps that analysts have nothing but good things to say about new CEO Tim Cook.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • PDCO

    Patterson Companies (PDCO -10.1%) takes a hit this morning after its FQ1 revenue missed...

    Patterson Companies (PDCO -10.1%) takes a hit this morning after its FQ1 revenue missed estimates, primarily due to a shortened sales quarter and employee-related expenses. The company also said it's acquiring Long Island distributor Veterinary Supply Corp. for an undisclosed sum.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • SIGM

    Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM), a developer of video processing chips for set-top boxes, TVs, and...

    Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM), a developer of video processing chips for set-top boxes, TVs, and Blu-Ray players, is down 12% after reporting FQ2 revenue of $46.7M (-23% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.44, missing consensus by $5.7M and $0.42. Sigma has been dogged by concerns of product commoditization and competition from Broadcom (BRCM). (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • BAX

    Baxter International (BAX -1.95%) buys privately held Baxa Corp. for $380M in cash in an effort...

    Baxter International (BAX -1.95%) buys privately held Baxa Corp. for $380M in cash in an effort to expand its portfolio of nutrition products and drug delivery systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • CAL

    Shares of Brown Shoe (BWS -15.2%) fall sharply following its Q2 earnings report and announcement...

    Shares of Brown Shoe (BWS -15.2%) fall sharply following its Q2 earnings report and announcement it's selling its AND 1 brand for $55M to Galaxy International. The firm missed the consensus EPS estimate by $0.10 and reported in-line revenue of $628M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • SLH

    Automotive insurance software firm Solera Holdings (SLH -11%) dives after reporting FQ4 revenue...

    Automotive insurance software firm Solera Holdings (SLH -11%) dives after reporting FQ4 revenue of $182.1M (+18% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.62, beating consensus by $6.6M and $0.02. FY12 guidance for revenue of $822M-$832M and EPS of $2.85-$2.90 is slightly above consensus, but it looks like the market was expecting more. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • BAC

    Regional bank stocks (KRE +1.5%) are also feeling the force of gravity from Bank of America's...

    Regional bank stocks (KRE +1.5%) are also feeling the force of gravity from Bank of America's (BAC +17.2%) big day. Winners include: STBA +4.4%, CPF +2.6%, SASR +2.3%, FHN +2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • BRK.A

    Warren Buffett made $700M in the first 30 minutes of trading with Berkshire's (BRK.A +0.3%)...

    Warren Buffett made $700M in the first 30 minutes of trading with Berkshire's (BRK.A +0.3%) investment in Bank of America (BAC +17%). His investment came with warrants to buy 700M BofA shares at ~$7.14 each - a $700M paper profit so far.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 9 Comments
  • BRK.A

    Bank stocks are surging following news of Berkshire's (BRK.A, BRK.B) investment in Bank of...

    Bank stocks are surging following news of Berkshire's (BRK.A, BRK.B) investment in Bank of America (BAC +17.2%). MS +7.2%. WFC +4.4%. GS +3.3%. C +6.6%. JPM +3.9%. PNC +2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • TIVO

    TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO) is up 12.8% as analysts praise yesterday's Q2 results. Janney's Tony Wilbe...

    TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO) is up 12.8% as analysts praise yesterday's Q2 results. Janney's Tony Wilbe thinks TiVo is at an "inflection point," while Caris' David Miller is upgrading shares on the belief legal expenses are dropping following a settlement with DISH. A report DTV will soon ship a long-delayed TiVo box could also be helping. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) shares rocket higher after announcing a $5B investment from Berkshire...

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) shares rocket higher after announcing a $5B investment from Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A). BAC will sell 50,000 shares of cumulative perpetual preferred stock with a liquidation value of $100,000/share to Berkshire in a private offering. The preferred stock will carry a 6% dividend. BAC +20.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 24 Comments
  • SONE

    Banking software firm S1 (NASDAQ:SONE) is up 3.6% after ACI Worldwide (NASDAQ:ACIW) raises the...

    Banking software firm S1 (NASDAQ:SONE) is up 3.6% after ACI Worldwide (NASDAQ:ACIW) raises the cash portion of its hostile bid for S1 to $6.20/share from a prior $5.70/share (to go with 0.1064 ACI shares). Earlier this month, S1 rejected ACI's prior bid, and reaffirmed its plans to acquire Fundtech (NASDAQ:FNDT).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • SIG

    Premarket gainers: SIG +10%. PSTI +10%. TIVO +9%. BCS +5%.Losers: SIGM -10%. AMAT -6%. NBG -4%....

    Premarket gainers: SIG +10%. PSTI +10%. TIVO +9%. BCS +5%.
    Losers: SIGM -10%. AMAT -6%. NBG -4%. SMI -3%. SDRL -3%. NVS -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) gains 2.8% premarket after catching an upgrade from Stifel to Buy from...

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) gains 2.8% premarket after catching an upgrade from Stifel to Buy from Hold on valuation. Shares of the tech concern are off 30% in the last two months on concerns over the global demand for networking hardware.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • ORIT

    Oritani Financial (NASDAQ:ORIT) is up 3% premarket after S&P announces the firm will be a...

    Oritani Financial (NASDAQ:ORIT) is up 3% premarket after S&P announces the firm will be a new addition to the S&P SmallCap 600 Index replacing optionsXpress (NASDAQ:OXPS) after the close of trading on August 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE) is up 5.7% premarket after announcing it landed $150M in...

    Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE) is up 5.7% premarket after announcing it landed $150M in working capital from new investors. The investment in the energy concern is in the form of 7.50% convertible notes due in 2016, and will be used to support a broad clean energy infrastructure program.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) is down 5.7% after posting FQ3 results featuring a massive Q/Q...

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) is down 5.7% after posting FQ3 results featuring a massive Q/Q drop in orders, and (unsurprisingly) guiding FQ4 numbers below consensus. During Applied's CC, management talked of weak PC and TV demand affecting orders, but also expressed optimism about solar demand gradually picking up. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM | 3 Comments
  • RUE

    Rue21 (NASDAQ:RUE) reports revenue was flat at its stores open at least a year, as it misses...

    Rue21 (NASDAQ:RUE) reports revenue was flat at its stores open at least a year, as it misses consensus Q2 EPS estimates by a penny . The company keeps a FY11 EPS forecast of $1.50-$1.54 in place, saying it sees low single digit comparable store sales in Q3. Shares down 11% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • AAPL

    U.S. stock index futures have rebounded to their best level of the session, S&P 500 +0.3%....

    U.S. stock index futures have rebounded to their best level of the session, S&P 500 +0.3%. Nasdaq futures are back to nearly flat as Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), off nearly 7% post-Jobs, is down 1.6%. To those who bounced out of Apple last night, did they consider the shares' low PE (given its high growth) may have already priced in the CEO's departure?

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • AU

    Gold continues to slump, off another 2.2% to $1,717/oz. First Sino-Forest, then Citibank and...

    Gold continues to slump, off another 2.2% to $1,717/oz. First Sino-Forest, then Citibank and BofA, then Hewlett-Packard, and now gold. The markets seem to be slicing through John Paulson's major positions one by one. AngloGold (NYSE:AU) -0.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 AM
  • SIG

    Signet Group (NYSE:SIG): Q2 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $797.6M (+10.8% Y/Y) beats...

    Signet Group (NYSE:SIG): Q2 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $797.6M (+10.8% Y/Y) beats by $31M. Shares +6.5% premarket. (PR)
